Detailed Description

Macro Definition Documentation

#define VOIP_CODEC_ACTIVE   (-1)

operate on active codec (passed for ident, valid for VoipDestroy, VoipControl)

Referenced by VoipCodecDecode(), VoipCodecDestroy(), VoipCodecEncode(), VoipCodecReset(), VoipControl(), and VoipHeadsetControl().

#define VOIP_CODEC_OUTPUT_FRACTIONAL   (12)

used by some of the fractional integer codes

Referenced by VoipControl().

Function Documentation

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecControl ( int32_t  iCodecIdent,
int32_t  iControl,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

Control codec.

Parameters
iCodecIdent- codec identifier, or VOIP_CODEC_ACTIVE
iControl- control selector
iValue- selector specific
iValue2- selector specific
*pValue- selector specific
Returns
int32_t - selector specific
Note
iControl can be one of the following:
        '+vad' - enable/disable vad
        'vada' - signal level threshold used to detect silence in a single frame (in millionths)
        'vadf' - number of silence frames required for silence detection to kick in
Version
08/09/2004 (jbrookes)

References VoipCodecRefT::bVadEnabled, FALSE, VoipCodecRefT::fVadPowerThreshold, VoipCodecRefT::iVadSilenceFramesThreshold, NetPrintf, VoipCodecRegT::pCodecDef, VoipCodecRegT::pCodecRef, VoipCodecDefT::pControl, and TRUE.

Referenced by VoipControl(), and VoipHeadsetControl().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecCreate ( int32_t  iCodecIdent,
int32_t  iDecodeChannels 
)

Create a codec module of the given type.

Parameters
iCodecIdent- identifier with which the codec will be tagged
iDecodeChannels- number of decoder channels
Returns
int32_t - zero=success, negative=failure
Version
08/04/2004 (jbrookes)

References VoipCodecRefT::fVadPowerThreshold, VoipCodecRefT::iVadSilenceFramesThreshold, NetPrintf, VoipCodecRegT::pCodecDef, VoipCodecRegT::pCodecRef, VoipCodecDefT::pCreate, VOIPCODEC_DEFAULT_VAD_AMPLITUDE_THRESHOLD, VOIPCODEC_DEFAULT_VAD_FRAMES_THRESHOLD, and VoipCodecDestroy().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecDecode ( int32_t *  pOutput,
const uint8_t *  pInput,
int32_t  iInputBytes,
int32_t  iChannel 
)

Decode input data with the active codec.

Parameters
*pOutput- pointer to output buffer
*pInput- pointer to input compressed data
iInputBytes- size in bytes of input data
iChannel- the input channel whose data we are decoding
Returns
int32_t - number of output samples
Version
08/04/2004 (jbrookes)

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t VoipCodecStatus ( int32_t  iCodecIdent,
int32_t  iSelect,
int32_t  iValue,
void *  pBuffer,
int32_t  iBufSize 
)

Get codec status.

Parameters
iCodecIdent- codec identifier, or VOIP_CODEC_ACTIVE
iSelect- status selector
iValue- selector-specific
*pBuffer- [out] selector-specific buffer space
iBufSize- size of output buffer
Version
08/09/2004 (jbrookes)
